conclusion: Object A is at rest, mass of A is 2 kg, spring constant of spring B is 200 N/m, spring C is initially not deformed.
The tension force of spring B on object A equals the gravitational force of A, the right endpoint of spring C is moved from position a to b, with ab = 60 cm = 0.6 m.
The gravitational force on A is F_g = mg = 2 x 9.8 = 19.6 N.
When the tension force of spring B equals the gravitational force, F_B = F_g = 19.6 N.
The extension of spring B is x_B = F_B/k_1 = 19.6/200 = 0.098 m.
The height increase of A is equal to the extension of spring B, h = x_B = 0.098 m.
The total extension of spring C is the horizontal distance ab = 0.6 m.
The vertical component of the extension of spring C is equal to the height increase of A, h = 0.098 m.
The force exerted by spring C is F_C = k_2 x_C.
The horizontal component of F_C must balance the force needed to extend spring B and counteract gravity.
The angle theta formed by the rope with the vertical can be found using trigonometry: cos theta = h/0.6 = 0.098/0.6.
The horizontal component of F_C is F_C cos theta.
The horizontal component of F_C must equal the force needed to extend spring B: F_C cos theta = 19.6 N.
Solving for F_C: F_C = 19.6 x 0.6/0.098 = 120 N.
Using F_C = k_2 x_C and x_C = 0.6 m: k_2 = F_C/x_C = 120/0.6 = 200 N/m.
The height that object A rises is 0.098 m, the spring constant k_2 of spring C is 200 N/m.
